Title: Amphora with Cover
Description: A rare and fine example of so-called "Egyptian blue" ceramic ware, this lovely vase has a form similar to contemporary vessels of alabaster.
Provenance: Dikran Kelekian, Paris and New York, [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [said to be from Luxor]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1914, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Egyptian Art
